TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCParticleBatchNode extends Cocos2D.CCNode implements class Cocos2D.ICCBlendProtocol, class Cocos2D.ICCTextureProtocol

Docs.summary: is like a batch node: if it contains children, it will draw them in 1 single OpenGL call (often known as "batch draw").

remarks.para: is like a batch node: if it contains children, it will draw them in 1 single OpenGL call (often known as "batch draw").

A can reference one and only one texture (one image file, one texture atlas). Only the ParticleSystems that are contained in that texture can be added to the . All ParticleSystems added to a are drawn in one OpenGL ES draw call. If the ParticleSystems are not added to a then an OpenGL ES draw call will be needed for each one, which is less efficient.

item.description: At the moment only ParticleSystemQuad is supported

remarks.description: At the moment only ParticleSystemQuad is supported

item.description: All systems need to be drawn with the same parameters, blend function, aliasing, texture

remarks.description: All systems need to be drawn with the same parameters, blend function, aliasing, texture

item.description: Initialize the ParticleBatchNode with the texture and enough capacity for all the particle systems

remarks.description: Initialize the ParticleBatchNode with the texture and enough capacity for all the particle systems

item.description: Initialize all particle systems and add them as child to the batch node v1.1

remarks.description: Initialize all particle systems and add them as child to the batch node v1.1

A interger to identify the node easily. Please refer to setTag(int)
Docs.summary: Adds a child to the container with z order and tag

remarks.para: Adds a child to the container with z order and tag
If the child is added to a 'running' node, then 'onEnter' and 'onEnterTransitionDidFinish' will be called immediately.

Docs.summary: Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:

remarks.para: Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:

item.description: glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node.

remarks.description: glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node.
